items.summary: Change the VideoPage in-video zoom UX so pinch-to-zoom/pan and the on-screen zoom controls do not activate/show automatically when the video is opened or when the user performs a normal first tap on the video; zoom must only become active after an explicit user action that indicates intent to zoom (e.g., tapping a dedicated “Enable Zoom” / “Zoom” control).

Implement a clear, user-facing zoom enable/disable control on VideoPage for touch devices (coarse pointer) that toggles zoom mode: when zoom mode is disabled, do not attach pinch/pan touch handlers and do not opt the container into zoom-allowed behavior; when zoom mode is enabled, attach the pinch/pan handlers and allow the custom zoom system to work.

Update/extend the existing Playwright smoke coverage (or add a focused UI test) to prevent regression: verify that the VideoPage does not show custom zoom controls by default on initial render and that zoom controls only become visible/usable after enabling zoom mode.
